title: Selling car online to Driveway for the first time
text: Thank you Kayleen, Jada and all team members at Driveway for helping me sold my first car online. At first, I was skeptical and thought it would be complicated to sell the car online. However, it was easy as 1 2 3 through Driveway. The transaction was smooth and straight forward. I would definitely recommend my family and friends to Driveway.This is how it works, Driveway send out both the online electronic Docusign through email and physical paperwork overnight to you with instruction where to sign it. You sign both the electronic and physical paperwork and postmark the physical paperwork within 3 days in the provided UPS envelop.  Once Driveway receive and process the paperwork, the car would be scheduled for pickup depending on where you live. Driveway then send a U.S bank link over email for you to fill in your banking information. Keep in mind, when the car is picked up onto the transport trailer, just snap a photo and send it to Driveway dispatch team. Call dispatch team for confirmation and the fund would be release to your banking account. That's it.

title: I made my first purchase with driveway

He was outstanding and was very helpful and informative and really on the ball for answering all my questions before I even decided to make the purchase. He really went out of his way to contact the dealer and have them send me extra pictures.After deciding to make my purchase, I was passed along to dane, who was my go to guy for the delivery after delivery process. Dane was truly outstanding and answered a million questions on my part. There was a few issues with the car upon receipt that I was not aware of. Dane took it upon himself to reach out and get these small issues resolved and really went to bat for me and made me feel really great about the choice I made which made me happy with my purchase even though I had a seven day return window. If I'm being honest if it wasn't for these 2 gentlemen and their outstanding customer service, this would have been a  not so great experience. With that said every thing turned out great and I highly recommend the Driveway experience. I will definitely be back again if I have any future car needs.Also  a shout out to all the young ladies in the title and shipping department that helped along the way. They all had great communication skills.

title: I don't think I'll go back to buying locally
text: I wasn't sure what to expect but the process was smooth and everyone was very helpful. I picked the car I wanted on their website, talked to a few people, got some emails, made a payment, signed some online papers, signed some more papers sent to me in the mail some of which had to be notorized, sent them back, made my final payment, and got the car 5 days later. It arrived in PERFECT condition and is the most beautiful car I have ever owned. Honestly, I much prefer buying a car this way and probably won't go back to buying locally. Their inventory is just too large to ignore, it's all in great condition, and the process is fast and easy. It takes a bit longer than buying locally but for me it's worth it. So yeah, 10/10 for Driveway.

text: I had a really great experience with driveway! The customer service was top notch. Diana walked me through every step of the way and was consistently available via text , email or by phone to assist with any questions. Once all of the paperwork was completed they scheduled the pick up. An awesome gentleman named Noel Walkes reached out an hour before scheduled pick up time and was able to show up early. Noel conducted the final inspection and the RTP hit my bank account on the spot! He was very professional and had a great disposition. Beginning to end I had a great experience with Driveway and would absolutely recommend using them to sell your car!

title: This was the easiest car selling…
text: This was the easiest car selling experience to date. Simple guide for photographing the vehicle, fair value for the sale, easy communication with the service individuals via text and calls. No complaints!

title: Driveway.com went to distance to earn my business and dispel my doubts.
text: Driveway.com actually expects you to sign ownership of your vehicle over to them, THEN schedule and appointment to have your car picked up, After that, arrangements will be made for funds to be transferred, either immediately AFTER you have relinquished your vehicle or in some cases, 3-5 business days later. I'm ASTOUNDED that ANYONE would agree to such terms. At that point, if Driveway.com finds or INVENTS fault or changes their mind, they can pay whatever they'd like, and seller would have to resort to litigation to get redress? They aren't kidding when they say possession is 9/10s of the law. I told them to kick rocks, think you should too.UPDATE:After the initial review (above) I was contacted by their head of operations. He confirmed the policies, but assured me that he could verify that my bank participated in their Immediate Payment system, which in fact they did. Still wasn't thrilled about having to sign and ship documents prior to getting funds, but agreed to try.  But turns out it went like clock work. Dealer rep showed up on schedule to pick up the car, and when I asked about funds transfer, he said he had no idea since he wasn't with Driveway So I told him no go until I contact Driveway, which I did. The rep there spoke to the dealer's driver to confirm pickup, and IMMEDIATELY initiated payment. The funds hit my account before the vehicle left my driveway (no pun intended). Driveway went the extra mile to make the deal, and earned my trust. Can't speak to buying, but selling to them turned out to be easy and reliable, and they made BY FAR the most reasonable offer. I would recommend.

title: This is an update to a previous review
text: This is an update to a previous review. Ryan T. Was our go-to guy for the purchase. He is awesome! This was a first car purchase for our son who needs to follow step by step what is needed. Their process allows that. So much better than sitting in front of a finance person who shoves papers and a whole lot of double talk at you. Our issue was NOT with Driveway.com but with the dealership (of course). The dealership paperwork did not match the proposal we signed with Driveway.com and we didn't realize it until later in the day. Ryan went above and beyond his job responsibilities to work with contracts and the dealership to get this right. We did get a refund of the difference from the dealership. Patrik from Driveway reached out to us during this time based on our initial review and between him and Ryan they provided stellar customer service. Thank goodness because the dealership was not helpful nor responsive. I would definitely use Driveway.com again just to avoid dealing with a dealership ever again! Not much has changed with the dealership business model since I bought my first car 40 years ago!

Spoke with service department & was told it's under 60 day warranty.Took a week for approval to do repairs! My car has been at the dealership for 2 weeks now & still no update on when the parts will arrived! I’m here to express my appreciation for Driveway. Although, it started off rocky they definitely finished STRONG! Sarah is truly AMAZING! I know now, that Driveway wasn’t the problem. I just needed to speak with the right person! I got pictures and verified it was acceptable - I asked if there was any other damage and was told NO.  upon delivery of vehicle, there was a dent (through the paint) in passenger front door.  I immediately filed a report and was told to take vehicle to dealer to get estimate which came in at ($1300).   two weeks later Driveway offers me $200 and I say, no thanks I'll return vehicle - they say I missed deadline after dragging their feet for two weeks.  they refuse to fix damage, refuse to pay estimate from their own partner, and refuse to accept return - Shady business practice at best.

text: Not trying to be hyperbolic but I think this might have been THE smoothest and most accommodating process/service I have ever used. Car broke down, was very stressed about getting a new car as finances have been tight. Did some research and found Driveway. I got prequalified in less than 10 minutes. Then got approved for multiple vehicles for $500 down and decent monthly car payments. Every step of the process was super streamlined and so easy that I thought there had to be some type of catch. Spoke with agents through the whole process. They were super communicative, punctual and friendly. Even ended up having casual conversation with them. title: My first car purchase in America
text: Writing my review after my successful purchase with driveway. Everything went off well and was better than expected. It started off a little on the negative side as two of the cars I initially wanted to purchase did not work out but then the car I ended up with was absolutely perfect. I would like to thank Amanda from the initial sales and customer service department who gave me a proper and thorough explanation of the entire process. She is very thorough with regards to the process and did not give me any unrealistic expectations. Cheyenne was also super quick in getting my car delivered to me. Kasandra from the post - delivery customer satisfaction department helped in getting minor issues fixed and did so very quickly. Thank you all at Driveway.com. Now I await my plates and the hope for a speedy conclusion to the registration process. I would definitely recommend driveway to anyone looking to purchase a car online.

title: I can vouch for Driveway.com!
text: I’m going to be honest…It was a little nerve-wracking buying a car on the internet, where I basically have no chance to test drive it before making the purchase and where I must rely on the car being delivered to me. It seems like so much can go wrong, right? But I checked out driveway.com despite my worries and they had an unbeatable price on just the car I was looking for, and I really appreciated the 7-day grace period to test out the car. To top it off, the estimate for my trade-in was the highest offer I received. So I just took a leap of faith! The salesman (Joshua) I dealt with over the phone and via text was kind and helpful through his end of the process, and the others were helpful and informative as well. But it was Noemi Gamez (Dispatch Coordinator) who provided stellar customer service - she constantly provided me with updates and was very responsive to my texts. There were some delays due to VIN issues, but she was persistent about getting the car to me as soon as she could. She’s the Dispatch Coordinator you want on your side. The driver who delivered my vehicle did it right on time and was also very pleasant. I originally gave driveway.com 4 out of 5 stars just because there’s nearly a different contact for each step of the process, and you might have to wait up to a month to get your car, depending on if there are any administrative hurdles along the way. I first spoke to the salesmen on 6/30, and I received my car on 7/25. Also, when I tried to contact the salesman about my VIN issue (after I signed the paperwork to purchase), I never heard back from him. But now that the deal is done and I’ve had a chance to reflect, the process was relatively smooth. I was given my temporary tags along with the car (I recommend asking for an email copy as well, just in case). I was then sent my permanent license plate and registration stickers a couple of weeks after I received my car!  And again, Noemi was so good to work with. Just remember that you’re not getting your car the same day; you have to be ok with waiting a few weeks to a month for delivery. Just stay on top of status and make sure you know who to contact, depending on what step you are at in the process. All in all, a good experience for me. I’d do it again!
